trans-unit.target: TEXT_LUCKZA017_03359_SEQ_00<tab><var 48 F201FC /var><var 49 F201FD /var> Quest Sync<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> The bonded servant fidgets with uncertainty.
TEXT_LUCKZA017_03359_TODO_00<tab>Speak with the venerable villager.
TEXT_LUCKZA017_03359_TODO_01<tab>Harvest stalks of golden barley.
TEXT_LUCKZA017_03359_TODO_02<tab>Deliver the stalks of golden barley to the venerable villager.
TEXT_LUCKZA017_03359_TODO_03<tab>Deliver the bottle of Wright ale to the bonded servant.

TEXT_LUCKZA017_03359_SERVANT03359_000_000<tab>Excuse me, <var 08 E905 ((miss)) ((sir)) /var>, but you are a fellow visitor here, yes? I wonder if you would be willing to perform for me a trifling service...

TEXT_LUCKZA017_03359_SERVANT03359_000_001<tab>I serve a particular family of the Eulmoran elite, and it is at the behest of my patron─a man with a discerning taste for fine drink─that I have ventured to the famous breweries of Wright.

TEXT_LUCKZA017_03359_SERVANT03359_000_002<tab>Oh, do you not partake yourself? Otherwise you would surely be aware of Wright's incomparable ale, and its glowing reputation amongst the privileged of Eulmore!

TEXT_LUCKZA017_03359_SERVANT03359_000_003<tab>In recent years, however, it seems distribution of this golden liquid has ground to a halt, and thus have I been sent to make a purchase directly from the source.
TEXT_LUCKZA017_03359_SERVANT03359_000_004<tab>A simple task, you might think...except the people of Wright are not overly receptive to visitors from Eulmore. Downright dismissive, in fact!

TEXT_LUCKZA017_03359_SERVANT03359_000_005<tab>Do you understand my dilemma? I need you to speak to the villagers, and procure a supply of ale in my stead─a service for which you will be paid most handsomely!
TEXT_LUCKZA017_03359_SERVANT03359_000_006<tab>Pray bargain with the villagers on my behalf, and I shall see you rewarded for any ale you acquire.
TEXT_LUCKZA017_03359_OLDWOMAN03359_000_010<tab>Hm? You're wantin' to buy some Wright ale?
TEXT_LUCKZA017_03359_OLDWOMAN03359_000_011<tab>Well now, we was indeed famous for our ale once, but that age is long past...
TEXT_LUCKZA017_03359_OLDWOMAN03359_000_012<tab>Any barley we grow these days is bound for the oven or the cookin' pot─there's naught to be spared for brewin' beers and the like.
TEXT_LUCKZA017_03359_OLDWOMAN03359_000_013<tab>You put that young back to work bringin' in the harvest, though, and I might be convinced to part with a bottle from my private stock...
TEXT_LUCKZA017_03359_OLDWOMAN03359_000_014<tab>Help me harvest the field there, and I'll see what ale I've got left hidin' in the larder.
TEXT_LUCKZA017_03359_OLDWOMAN03359_000_020<tab>You've brought me my barley, then?
TEXT_LUCKZA017_03359_OLDWOMAN03359_000_021<tab>Thank you, <var 08 E905 ((lass)) ((lad)) /var>. There's fewer hands around to help out ever since the... <cough>

TEXT_LUCKZA017_03359_OLDWOMAN03359_000_022<tab>It's a good drop, our Wright ale is. Slides down the throat like honeyed sunshine, so they say, and afore you know it you've downed the whole damn bottle.
TEXT_LUCKZA017_03359_OLDWOMAN03359_000_023<tab>Drink it slow and easy, <var 08 E905 ((lass)) ((lad)) /var>, or you'll be wakin' up with a sore head come the morrow!
TEXT_LUCKZA017_03359_SERVANT03359_000_030<tab>Were you successful in your bargaining?

TEXT_LUCKZA017_03359_SERVANT03359_000_031<tab>I see... That would explain why the trickle of ale into Eulmore has ceased altogether. I shall report this situation to my patron, and see what can be provided in the form of laborers and surplus comestibles.
TEXT_LUCKZA017_03359_SERVANT03359_000_032<tab>In any case, I thank you for securing this precious bottle, kind traveler! Your payment, as promised...
